channel.title: Hash Cracking on TLDRBins
channel.description: Recent content in Hash Cracking on TLDRBins

item.title: Keepass
item.description:
Crack Master Password

keepass2john <KDBX_FILE> > hash

# With a key file
keepass2john -k <KEY_FILE> <KDBX_FILE> > hash

Basic

# Open kdbx
kpcli --kdb <KDBX_FILE>

# Open kdbx with a key file
kpcli --key <KEY_FILE> --kdb <KDBX_FILE>

# List all passwords
find .

# Show password (e.g. #0)
show -f 0

# Export attachment (e.g. #0)
attach 0

Ref: Download kpcli

item.title: Kerberos
item.description:
Authentication Method

Kerberos Ticket

1. Configure /etc/hosts

# Always in this order - DC.example.com example.com DC
sudo nxc smb <DC_IP> --generate-hosts-file /etc/hosts

$ sudo nxc smb 10.129.235.149 --generate-hosts-file /etc/hosts
SMB         10.129.235.149  445    DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 x64 (name:DC) (domain:administrator.htb) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) 
                                                                                                                                                                                                                    
$ tail -n1 /etc/hosts
10.129.235.149     DC.administrator.htb administrator.htb DC

2. Configure /etc/krb5.conf

# Always in UPPERCASE - DC.EXAMPLE.COM
sudo nxc smb <DC_IP> --generate-krb5-file /etc/krb5.conf

$ sudo nxc smb 10.129.235.149 --generate-krb5-file /etc/krb5.conf
SMB         10.129.235.149  445    DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 x64 (name:DC) (domain:administrator.htb) (signing:True) (SMBv1:False) 

$ cat /etc/krb5.conf

[libdefaults]
    dns_lookup_kdc = false
    dns_lookup_realm = false
    default_realm = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB

[realms]
    ADMINISTRATOR.HTB = {
        kdc = dc.administrator.htb
        admin_server = dc.administrator.htb
        default_domain = administrator.htb
    }

[domain_realm]
    .administrator.htb = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB
    administrator.htb = ADMINISTRATOR.HTB

item.title: MSSQL Privilege Escalation
item.description:
Authentication Method

Enumeration

1. Check Privesc Path

# Password
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -M mssql_priv

# NTLM
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -M mssql_priv

# Password-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M mssql_priv

# NTLM-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M mssql_priv

# Ticket-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache --kdcHost <DC> -M mssql_priv

# Local Auth
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M mssql_priv

2. List Users that Can be Impersonated

# Password
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -M enum_impersonate

# NTLM
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -M enum_impersonate

# Password-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_impersonate

# NTLM-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_impersonate

# Ticket-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_impersonate

# Local Auth
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_impersonate

$ nxc mssql DC.REDELEGATE.VL -u 'SQLGuest' -p 'zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii' --local-auth -M enum_impersonate
MSSQL       10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 (name:DC) (domain:redelegate.vl)
MSSQL       10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [+] DC\SQLGuest:zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii 
ENUM_IMP... 10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [-] No users with impersonation rights found.

3. Enumerate Active MSSQL Logins

# Password
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -M enum_logins

# NTLM
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -M enum_logins

# Password-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_logins

# NTLM-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_logins

# Ticket-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_logins

# Local Auth
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_logins

$ nxc mssql DC.REDELEGATE.VL -u 'SQLGuest' -p 'zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii' --local-auth -M enum_logins     
MSSQL       10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 (name:DC) (domain:redelegate.vl)
MSSQL       10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [+] DC\SQLGuest:zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii 
ENUM_LOGINS 10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [+] Logins found:
ENUM_LOGINS 10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [*]   - sa
ENUM_LOGINS 10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [*]   - SQLGuest

4. Enumerate Linked MSSQL Servers

# Password
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -M enum_links

# NTLM
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -M enum_links

# Password-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_links

# NTLM-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_links

# Ticket-based Kerberos
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -d <DOMAIN> -k --use-kcache --kdcHost <DC> -M enum_links

# Local Auth
nxc mssql <TARGET> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' --local-auth -M enum_links

$ nxc mssql DC.REDELEGATE.VL -u 'SQLGuest' -p 'zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii' --local-auth -M enum_links 
MSSQL       10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [*] Windows Server 2022 Build 20348 (name:DC) (domain:redelegate.vl)
MSSQL       10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [+] DC\SQLGuest:zDPBpaF4FywlqIv11vii 
ENUM_LINKS  10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [+] Linked servers found:
ENUM_LINKS  10.129.254.242  1433   DC               [*]   - WIN-Q13O908QBPG\SQLEXPRESS

1. Import Module

. .\PowerUpSQL.ps1

2. Audit

Invoke-SQLAudit -Instance <TARGET> -Username '<USER>' -Password '<PASSWORD>' -Verbose

3. Execute Query

Get-SQLQuery -Instance <TARGET> -Username '<USER>' -Password '<PASSWORD>' -Query "<QUERY>" -Verbose

Ref: PowerUpSQL.ps1

item.title: Password Cracking
item.description:
Convert File to Hash Format

# For example
ssh2john id_rsa_encrypted > hash

keepass2john test.kdbx > hash

zip2john test.zip > hash

# Get a full list of *2john
find / -name *2john 2>/dev/null


# General use
john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash

# Specify hash format
john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt hash --format=Raw-SHA512

# Show cracked hash
john --show hash

# Show cracked hash with specific format
john --show hash --format=Raw-SHA512

# Auto detect hash format
hashcat hash

# Specify hash format
hashcat -m <MODE> -a 0 hash /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --force

# Auto skip username and colon
hashcat hash --user

Create a Wordlist

# For example, 'Test' with 4 digits and a symbol
hashcat --stdout -a 3 Test?d?d?d?d?s > passwords.txt

$ hashcat --stdout -a 3 Test?d?d?d?d?s > passwords.txt
$ head passwords.txt 
Test1999*
Test2312.
Test5678*
Test0000.
Test9000.
Test8888*
Test3000.
Test4523.
Test7778*
Test6999*


+------------------------------------------+
|  ? | Charset                             |
| ===+=========                            |
|  l | abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz [a-z]    |
|  u | ABCDEFGHIJKLMNOPQRSTUVWXYZ [A-Z]    |
|  d | 0123456789                 [0-9]    |
|  h | 0123456789abcdef           [0-9a-f] |
|  H | 0123456789ABCDEF           [0-9A-F] |
|  s |  !"#$%&'()*+,-./:;<=>?@[\]^_`{|}~   |
|  a | ?l?u?d?s                            |
|  b | 0x00 - 0xff                         |
+-----------------------------------------+

Ref: Example Hashes

item.title: Shadow Hash Cracking
item.description:
Shadow Hash Cracking

# Prepare an unshadowed hashes file
unshadow passwd shadow > unshadowed


john --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt unshadowed

# yescrypt
john --format=crypt --wordlist=/usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt unshadowed

hashcat -m 7400 unshadowed /usr/share/wordlists/rockyou.txt --force --user

item.title: Time Roasting
item.description:
Authentication Method

Time Roasting

# Password
nxc smb <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -M timeroast

# NTLM
nxc smb <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -M timeroast

# Password-based Kerberos
nxc smb <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -p '<PASSWORD>' -k --kdcHost <DC> -M timeroast

# NTLM-based Kerberos
nxc smb <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -H '<HASH>' -k --kdcHost <DC> -M timeroast

# Ticket-based Kerberos
nxc smb <TARGET> -d <DOMAIN> -u '<USER>' -k --kdcHost <DC> --use-kcache -M timeroast
